entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French revenger, revengier, from re- + venger to avenge vengeance

def.dt: :to avenge (as oneself) usually by retaliating in kind or degree
:to inflict injury in return for revenge an insult

entry.et: Middle French revenge, revenche, from revengier, revenchier to revenge

def.dt: :a desire for revenge motivated by revenge
:an act or instance of retaliating in order to get even plotted her revenge
:an opportunity for getting satisfaction sought revenge through a rematch
:traveler's diarrhea especially when contracted in Mexico
